content:
Hi @all, myself mani, previously I have worked on setting up a standalone zulip production server (version 1.8.1) for my company. Now I've upgraded it to the latest in the zulip -> /dist/releases/.

I have gone through setting up a s3 storage for files and avatar uploads -> https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/docs/production/upload-backends.md ,
I have a 1gb of data in the current server and want to migrate it to the s3, in the above doc it was mentioned to take advice from the community. I'm waiting for your help. Let me know the procedure or any documents could help me.

Thanks in advance. Mani.

@Mani Sankar Nambaru not sure why you did an @all mention for your question. One way you can migrate to the S3 backend is to use Zulip's import/export tool to first import your data, and then export it. But I might be able to write a quick script for doing this tomorrow if you remind me (about to head to bed)

Hi @Tim Abbott, Sorry for mentioning @all in my question. I'm reminding you with the quick script for importing data from server and exporting data to s3 backend. Thanks for your help, Happy New Year :)
Hi @Tim Abbott , Is this the blog you were referring as import/export tool? -> https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/export-and-import.html#export-your-zulip-data
@Mani Sankar Nambaru yes, that's the import-export tool.

@Mani Sankar Nambaru https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/11294 I haven't had time to script this, but is an issue for tracking this; if you're a programmer you can probably follow my notes to do this migration.
@Tim Abbott, I'm not a programmer. Will try :+1:
